tit.cmt: 他のファイルの表現に合わせました

sen.j: 八幡造（はちまんづくり）は、日本の神社建築様式の1つである。
sen.e: The Hachiman-zukuri shrine style is one of the architectural styles of Shinto shrines in Japan.
The Hachiman-zukuri shrine style is one of the architectural styles of Shinto shrines in Japan.
The Hachiman-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルの表現に合わせました

sen.j: 宇佐神宮に代表される八幡造は、2棟の建物を前後に連結させてひとつの社殿になったもの。
sen.e: Hachiman-zukuri as represented by Usa-jigu Shrine a shrine pavilion built by interconnecting 2 buildings back to back.
Hachiman-zukuri, as represented by Usa-jigu Shrine, is a shrine pavilion built by interconnecting 2 buildings back to back.
Hachiman-zukuri, as represented by Usa-jigu Shrine, is a shrine pavilion built by interconnecting 2 buildings back to back.

sen.j: 日光東照宮などの権現造も、八幡造の派生といえる。
sen.e: It can be said that the Gongen-zukuri style such as Nikko Toshogu Shrine also derived from the Hachiman-zukuri style.
It can be said that the Gongen-zukuri style, exemplified by Nikko Toshogu Shrine, also derived from the Hachiman-zukuri style.
It can be said that the Gongen-zukuri style, exemplified by Nikko Toshogu Shrine, also derived from the Hachiman-zukuri style.

sen.j: 切妻造、平入のの2つの建物前殿（まえどの）・後殿（うしろどの）を前後に連結させ、中間に1間の相の間（あいのま）が付く。
sen.e: 2 buildings, the front hall and the rear hall built in the kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) and hirairi (the entrance to a building built parallel to the ridge of the roof, usually on the long side of the building), respectively, are interconnected back to back with Ainoma (Middle Room located between Honden main hall and Haiden oratory) in between them.

Two buildings, a front hall and a rear hall built in the kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof), and hirairi (the entrance to a building built parallel to the ridge of the roof, usually on the long side of the building), respectively, are interconnected back to back with an Ainoma (Middle Room located between Honden main hall and Haiden oratory) in between them.

Two buildings, a front hall and a rear hall built in the kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof), and hirairi (the entrance to a building built parallel to the ridge of the roof, usually on the long side of the building), respectively, are interconnected back to back with an Ainoma (Middle Room located between Honden main hall and Haiden oratory) in between them.

sen.j: 前殿を外殿・礼殿・細殿・出殿・出居殿といい、後殿を内殿とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: The front hall is referred to as Exterior Hall, 礼殿, 細殿, 出殿 or 出居殿, whereas, the rear hall is referred to as the Interior Hall.
sen.cmt: 礼殿・細殿・出殿・出居殿 - 読み・定訳不明
sen.e: The front hall is referred to as Exterior Hall, 礼殿, 細殿, 出殿 or 出居殿, whereas the rear hall is referred to as the Interior Hall.
The front hall is referred to as Exterior Hall, 礼殿, 細殿, 出殿 or 出居殿, whereas the rear hall is referred to as the Interior Hall.

sen.j: 前殿に椅子、後殿に帳台が置かれ、ともに神座である。
sen.e: A chair is placed in the anterior hall, whereas, a 4-poster platform with drapes is placed in the posterior hall with both the chair and platform being shinza (the seat of the deity).
A chair is placed in the anterior hall, whereas a 4-poster platform with drapes is placed in the posterior hall, with both the chair and platform serving as shinza (the seat of the deity).
A chair is placed in the anterior hall, whereas a 4-poster platform with drapes is placed in the posterior hall, with both the chair and platform serving as shinza (the seat of the deity).

sen.j: 昼は前殿、夜は奥殿に神が移動するとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the god moves to the anterior hall during the day and moves to the posterior hall in the evening.
It is said that the god moves to the anterior hall during the day and moves to the posterior hall in the evening.
It is said that the god moves to the anterior hall during the day and moves to the posterior hall in the evening.

sen.j: 前殿と後殿の軒の接する谷間に金属製の樋を渡して雨水を受ける構造になっている。
sen.e: Metal gutters are installed in the gully formed where the eaves of the anterior and posterior halls meet to catch rainwater.
Metal gutters are installed in the valley formed where the eaves of the anterior and posterior halls meet to catch rainwater.
Metal gutters are installed in the valley formed where the eaves of the anterior and posterior halls meet to catch rainwater.

sen.j: 側面切妻の破風は、懸魚で修飾される。
sen.e: Ridges of gables are decorated with gegyo (decorative wooden board used to cover the ridge and purlin ends on a roof gable).
Ridges of gables are decorated with gegyo (decorative wooden boards used to cover the ridge and purlin ends on a roof gable).
Ridges of gables are decorated with gegyo (decorative wooden boards used to cover the ridge and purlin ends on a roof gable).
Columns
Columns
Columns

sen.j: 左右対称で、左右方向には偶数本の柱が配される。
sen.e: Columns are symmetrical and there are even number of columns on either the right or left side.
Columns are symmetrical, and there are even numbers of columns on the right and left sides.
Columns are symmetrical, and there are even numbers of columns on the right and left sides.
Walls
Walls
Walls

sen.j: 正面中央の1か所に観音開き御扉が、相の間の両側面にも扉が設けられている。
sen.e: There are double doors at the center of the façade and an additional door on either side of Ainoma.
There are double doors at the center of the façade and an additional door on either side of the Ainoma.
There are double doors at the center of the façade and an additional door on either side of the Ainoma.

sen.j: 外側には回縁が廻らされる。
sen.e: Verandahs surround the exterior of the buildings.
Verandas surround the exterior of the buildings.
Verandas surround the exterior of the buildings.
Floors
Floors
Floors

sen.j: 相の間の床だけ低いのが古式である。
sen.e: The floors of Ainoma are recessed in accordance with ancient ritual.
The floors of the Ainoma are recessed in accordance with ancient ritual.
The floors of the Ainoma are recessed in accordance with ancient ritual.
Usa-jingu Shrine (Oita Prefecture)
